title: Trump's Tariffs Send U.S. Aluminum Prices to Record Highs
summary: U.S. aluminum prices reached a record $4,816 per ton due to sharply tightened domestic inventories caused by tariffs imposed by the Trump administration. The tariffs, which doubled to 50%, have reduced imports from Canada and contributed to shrinking U.S. aluminum inventory, pushing prices higher amid strong demand and supply constraints.

title: Aluminum premium reaches record high in the US due to tariffs and global squeeze
summary: The U.S. aluminum premium hit a record high, with buyers paying $4,792 per ton when the base price is $2,850, driven by tariffs and global supply reductions including Chinese mine disruptions and smelter output cuts. The Midwest premium rose to 88.10 cents per pound, reflecting increased costs from duties and supply tightness.

title: LME aluminium cash offer rises to $2,867.5/t as opening stocks fall 0.47% to 525,800t
summary: The London Metal Exchange (LME) aluminum cash offer increased to $2,867.5 per tonne amid a 0.47% decline in opening stocks to 525,800 tonnes, indicating tightening supply conditions in the aluminum market.

title: Aluminum Hits 4-week High
summary: Aluminum prices increased to $2,917 per tonne, the highest level since November 2025, gaining 1.35% over the past four weeks and rising 9.71% over the last 12 months. The market is influenced by macroeconomic factors supporting manufacturing activity and supply constraints.

title: US Aluminum Prices Surge Above Those in Overseas Markets
summary: U.S. aluminum prices have surged above international levels, driven by tariffs and supply constraints, causing a record-high premium for the lightweight metal in the U.S. market. This price divergence reflects the impact of trade policies and domestic supply-demand imbalances.

title: Commodity Update – December 2025: U.S. Aluminum Industry Faces High Energy Costs Amid Rising Demand
summary: The U.S. aluminum industry is under pressure from high electricity prices and competition for power with tech companies, despite strong demand driven by data centers and hyperscale projects. Aluminum prices have increased approximately 55% year to date, but experts emphasize the need for immediate investment and regulatory improvements to sustain competitiveness and reduce import reliance.

title: Aluminum Prices Rebound from One-Month Low Amid Supply Constraints and Production Challenges
summary: Aluminum futures rebounded above $2,850 per tonne after hitting a near one-month low, supported by macroeconomic tailwinds and supply disruptions including equipment failure at Iceland’s Grundartangi smelter. China plans to curb overcapacity with a production cap of 45 million tons annually and faces setbacks in building smelters in Indonesia due to energy costs and regulatory hurdles.

title: Alcoa Reports Rising Tariff Costs on Aluminum Shipments Offset by Higher Domestic Prices
summary: Alcoa Corp. disclosed that U.S. tariffs on Canadian aluminum increased its costs by $69 million compared to the previous quarter, but higher domestic aluminum prices have offset these tariff impacts. The company expects tariff costs to rise further and highlighted the influence of declining inventory and imports on rising U.S. aluminum prices.

title: Secondary Aluminum Alloy Ingot Social Inventory Drops on December 9
summary: Short-term aluminum price fluctuations have intensified, suppressing downstream procurement pace, with some die-casting enterprises facing challenges. The release of production from new aluminum capacity is expected to take some time, resulting in limited production growth in December.

title: On December 1st, Molten Aluminum Production Growth Limited Due to New Capacity Ramp-Up
summary: The release of production from new aluminum capacity requires time, leading to limited production growth in early December. This reflects ongoing adjustments in aluminum output amid market conditions.

title: Aluminum's Impact on Sustainable Development Goals
summary: This article discusses how aluminum drives sustainable development through innovations in recycling, energy efficiency, and economic growth. It highlights technology priorities such as improving recycling efficiency, reducing processing costs, and expanding recycled aluminum applications, especially in electric vehicles and construction. The piece also explores market projections through 2030, emphasizing investment opportunities in recycling infrastructure, renewable energy integration, and supply chain optimization.

title: Novelis Wins German Ecodesign Award for Recycled Aluminium Automotive Sheet
summary: Novelis received the German Ecodesign Award for its production-ready aluminum alloy made with 100% recycled end-of-life automotive scrap. The alloy, Novelis Advanz™ 6F – e170RC, contains at least 75% recycled content and demonstrates the feasibility of true car-to-car aluminum recycling. This innovation supports significant CO₂ savings by reducing energy consumption and emissions by up to 95% compared to primary aluminum production.

title: Aluminum Recycling Market to Reach US$91.3 Billion by 2032 as Global Demand for Low-Carbon Metals & Circular Manufacturing Surges
summary: The aluminum recycling industry is undergoing rapid growth driven by technological innovation, policy acceleration, and market demand for sustainable materials. Recycling aluminum uses about 95% less energy than primary production, leading to major carbon footprint reductions. Advances include hydrogen-powered remelting furnaces, AI-guided scrap sorting, and OEM mandates for high recycled content in electric vehicles, positioning the market for significant expansion by 2032.

title: RAME™ Maximising Aluminium Value & Sustainability In Aluminium Dross Recovery
summary: Altek Europe introduced RAME™, a salt-free dross processing technology for primary aluminum smelters that maximizes aluminum recovery and produces valuable alumina for reuse. This innovation supports zero-waste goals and circular economy principles by recycling 100% of materials on-site, enhancing sustainability in aluminum production.

title: HRC Steel Price Trends and Forecasts
summary: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) Steel traded flat at 908 USD/T on December 8, 2025, showing a 6.70% rise over the past month and a 34.52% increase compared to the same time last year. The price is expected to reach 914.08 USD/T by the end of the quarter and 998.71 USD/T within 12 months, reflecting positive market momentum despite recent fluctuations.

title: Commodity Update – December 2025
summary: Canada maintains a 25% counter-tariff on steel and aluminum imports from the U.S., effective through late December, impacting trade dynamics. The U.S. and EU are negotiating tariff reductions on steel and aluminum amid ongoing trade tensions. Steelmakers face challenges from unfair international competition and escalating trade tensions, influencing production and layoffs globally.

title: Cleveland-Cliffs and Carmakers Embrace Multi-Year, Fixed-Price Contracts
summary: Cleveland-Cliffs is ending slab supply to ArcelorMittal Calvert and shifting toward multi-year, fixed-price steel contracts with automotive manufacturers to provide supply and cost certainty amid current trade and tariff environments. The company anticipates a U.S. automotive production resurgence, preparing to increase steel supply significantly despite weaker vehicle sales.

title: American Steel Producers Gradually Raising Prices for Rolled Products
summary: American steel producers, including Nucor Bar Group, are incrementally increasing prices for rolled steel products, with Nucor raising rebar prices by $30 per short ton for new orders after November 7. This reflects ongoing adjustments in response to market conditions and tariff impacts.

title: JSW Steel records 5% growth in crude steel production
summary: JSW Steel reported a 5% year-over-year increase in consolidated crude steel production for November 2025, reaching 24.39 lakh tonnes. Capacity utilization of Indian operations was at 84%, impacted by the shutdown of Blast Furnace 3 at Vijayanagar for capacity upgradation from 3 to 4.5 MTPA.

title: U.S. Steel to restart steel production at Illinois plant
summary: U.S. Steel announced it will restart steelmaking at its Granite City Works plant in Illinois after a two-year idle period, citing rising customer demand and an improved steel market. The company plans to resume production in the first half of 2026 after hiring and training workers and preparing equipment.

title: US Steel to resume production at Illinois plant shut 3 years ago
summary: U.S. Steel will resume making steel slabs at its Granite City Works plant in Illinois, which was shut down in 2023. The decision follows increased steel demand and government pressure, with plans to restart blast furnace operations and hire 400 workers to operate the plant by mid-2026.

title: Green Innovations: Increasing uptake of sustainable practices in road construction
summary: The article highlights growing adoption of sustainable practices in road construction, including the use of steel slag and blast furnace slag as by-products of the steel industry. ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India secured a technology licence in July 2025 to convert steel slag into engineered road aggregates, with roads built using these materials estimated to be 40% more cost-effective and three times more durable than conventional pavements.

title: Peru Extends Dispute License Period, LME Copper Fluctuated Overnight and Closed Higher
summary: LME copper futures opened at $11,657.5/mt, fluctuated during the session, and closed slightly higher at $11,675/mt, up 0.09%. Supply remains tight with imported material arrivals limited, while domestic arrivals are normal. Downstream demand is weak, and inventories increased slightly to 160,300 mt as of December 8.

title: Copper price climbs to fresh high on China outlook boost
summary: Copper futures on the London Metal Exchange rose as much as 1.3% to $11,771/ton, surpassing previous all-time highs. The rally is driven by China's commitment to domestic growth and proactive fiscal policies for 2026, boosting demand prospects. Supply concerns persist due to US stockpiling and global mine outages, with analysts forecasting a global refined copper shortfall of 450,000 tons next year.

title: BHP shares take centre stage as Citi tips record-breaking copper price to storm even higher
summary: Copper prices reached a fresh all-time high above US$11,770 per tonne on the London Metal Exchange, gaining over 30% this year. Citi analysts project copper prices to average US$13,000 per tonne in Q2 2026, driven by a lower interest-rate environment, fiscal expansion in the US, European demand, and the global energy transition. This outlook is positive for BHP shares, a major copper producer.

title: Record‑setting Copper Prices Signal A Strained Global Metal Market
summary: Copper prices have reached new highs due to structural and operational setbacks in major producing regions, causing supply disruptions. Smelter output constraints and steady inventory drawdowns have created a distorted supply-demand balance. Long-term demand remains strong, supported by investments in grid modernization, electric vehicles, and energy infrastructure.

title: Copper Hits All-Time Highs! Scrap Prices Surge Heading Into December 2025
summary: Copper prices have broken all-time records, driven primarily by investor flows, thin London inventories, and uncertainty around US trade policy rather than industrial demand. The rally surprised many professionals and has significant implications for scrap and recycling markets.

title: Glencore Restructures Operations in Bet on Copper Production
summary: Glencore announced a restructuring involving around 1,000 job cuts to focus on increasing copper production, aiming for about 1.6 million metric tons annually by 2035. The company expects 2025 production to be at the lower end of its guidance range due to challenges at its Collahuasi mine and lowered its 2026 output guidance midpoint from 930,000 to 840,000 tons. Glencore plans to deliver over 1 million tons of copper annually by 2028, seeking partners to reduce risks in projects.

title: Peru Extends Dispute License Period, LME Copper Fluctuated Overnight and Closed Higher
source: SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes via Metal.com
summary: LME copper prices fluctuated overnight, closing slightly higher at $11,675/mt amid tight supply and weak downstream demand. Inventory changes showed a slight increase in LME copper cathode stocks and a decrease in SHFE warrant inventory. Imported copper prices saw minor changes, while domestic arrivals remained normal, indicating ongoing market volatility.

title: Column: Will the real Doctor Copper please step forward?
summary: Copper prices are surging to record highs globally due to a supply crunch, with physical premiums soaring and smelters facing concentrate shortages. LME copper stocks dropped below 100,000 metric tons after a large withdrawal likely destined for the US market, which is now the primary destination due to import tariff threats. Chinese smelters have pledged a 10% production cut to stabilize the market amid strong demand and tight supply.

title: Copper price climbs to fresh high on China outlook boost
summary: Copper prices reached new highs, climbing to $11,771 per ton on the LME, driven by US stockpiling and China's commitment to domestic growth in 2026. Analysts expect a global refined copper shortfall of 450,000 tons next year, with prices needing to average above $12,000 per ton to attract new mining investments. Demand is supported by sectors like data centers and electric vehicles, while supply is constrained by mine outages worldwide.

title: BHP shares take centre stage as Citi tips record-breaking copper price to storm even higher
summary: Copper prices hit a fresh all-time high above $11,770 per ton on the LME, with Citigroup forecasting prices to average $13,000 per ton in Q2 2026 due to strong demand from energy transition technologies and AI data centers. BHP, now the world's largest copper miner, is expanding output with a $840 million investment in South Australian projects, benefiting from the bullish copper market outlook.

title: True North grows Mt Oxide with funding
summary: True North Copper is raising $12.5 million to accelerate drilling and growth activities at its Mt Oxide Project in 2026, aiming to expand copper production capacity.

title: Rewiring Sustainable, Clean Energy Future With Copper
summary: Copper plays a crucial role in the global clean energy transition due to its high recyclability and superior electrical and thermal conductivity. The International Energy Agency projects copper demand for clean energy could nearly double by 2050, driven by electrification and renewable power expansion. Innovations in recycling and sustainable mining practices are key to ensuring copper supports a net-zero future with minimal environmental impact.

title: Beyond the grid – copper's decarbonization focus shifts toward mines
summary: Copper mining is focusing on reducing carbon emissions within mining operations themselves, especially Scope 1 emissions from diesel use. Major producers like Codelco are adopting electric mining equipment and partnering with academic institutions to develop decarbonization technologies. This shift is critical to maintaining copper's role in a low-carbon economy while addressing the carbon intensity of its extraction.

title: Gunnison Copper Announces That Rio Tinto's Nuton Technology Produces First Copper
summary: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology has achieved a breakthrough in copper production by producing copper with up to 80% less water usage and 60% lower carbon emissions compared to conventional methods. The technology shortens supply chains by producing copper cathode directly at the mine and extends mine life by extracting value from waste materials. Nuton aims to deliver the lowest carbon footprint copper in the U.S., supporting cleaner domestic supply chains.

title: Rio Tinto's Nuton tech makes first-ever copper cathode at Gunnison mine
summary: Nuton technology by Rio Tinto has produced its first copper cathode at the Gunnison mine, demonstrating cleaner, faster, and more efficient copper production at an industrial scale. The technology reduces water use by up to 80% and carbon emissions by up to 60%, while eliminating milling and refining steps. This innovation supports the production of low-carbon copper and strengthens the U.S. supply chain for sustainable copper.

title: How a New Jersey startup found an electrifying way to slash copper costs
summary: Still Bright, a New Jersey startup, has developed a novel copper extraction technology that recovers nearly all copper from ores and tailings without harmful pollution. Their vanadium-based solution process uses electricity to regenerate the solution, avoiding traditional burning methods that release pollutants. This innovation could significantly increase copper yield and reduce environmental impact amid rising global copper demand.

title: LME nickel price rebounds above $14,900 on weak US dollar expectations
summary: The London Metal Exchange (LME) nickel futures price rebounded above $14,900/ton, reaching a one-week high due to a weakening US dollar and expectations of a Federal Reserve interest rate cut. Despite the rebound, plentiful supply and weak demand from the stainless steel industry suggest continued price fluctuations.

title: Nickel prices were in the doldrums this week, with domestic inventory increasing slightly
summary: LME and SHFE nickel prices showed sideways movement, oscillating between $14,700/mt and $14,900/mt, amid weak trading and increased domestic inventory. Market expectations of a US Fed interest rate cut and geopolitical progress provided some support, but nickel prices are expected to remain range-bound in the short term.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel prices dropped to a four-year low due to a lackluster outlook from the Federal Reserve, which outweighed potential mining quota cuts in Indonesia. Despite Indonesia considering deep cuts to nickel mining quotas to support prices, a stronger dollar and higher financing costs pressured the market.

title: Nickel Daily: Nickel sulfate prices to reach a bottom and stabilize in December
summary: SHFE nickel prices showed an upward trend last week, with expectations that nickel sulfate prices will bottom out and stabilize in December. The report highlights a near-term range-bound outlook for nickel prices.

title: Nickel market set to remain in surplus through 2026: ING
summary: Global nickel supply is expected to exceed demand again in 2026, maintaining a market surplus. This outlook suggests continued pressure on nickel prices despite potential supply cuts.

title: Nornickel fully restores cobalt production after repairs from 2022 fire
summary: Norilsk Nickel has completed reconstruction of its cobalt production facility in the Murmansk region, damaged by a fire in 2022. The upgraded plant will increase cobalt production capacity from 1,000 to 3,000 tons per year, making it the only cobalt producer in Russia with high-purity output.

title: Norilsk Nickel resumed cobalt production in Monchegorsk
summary: Norilsk Nickel resumed cobalt production at the Kola Mining and Processing Plant after reconstruction, investing 5.3 billion rubles. The plant produces up to 3,000 tons per year of 99.9% pure metallic cobalt, used in batteries, catalysts, magnets, and aerospace.

title: Nickel still capped by surplus
summary: Global nickel supply is expected to exceed demand again in 2026, with Indonesia producing about 60% of global nickel. Stricter government controls and permit enforcement in Indonesia aim to manage supply and stabilize prices amid rising exports of nickel cathode from China and Indonesia.

title: Ardea on track for Kalgoorlie's DFS completion
summary: Ardea Resources is progressing toward completing a Definitive Feasibility Study for the Kalgoorlie Nickel Project in the first half of 2026. The project features a 3.5 million tonnes per year high pressure acid leach capacity and aims to produce nickel-cobalt mixed hydroxide precipitate with improved recovery and lower carbon footprint.

title: Tartisan Nickel starts drilling at Kenbridge project in Ontario
summary: Tartisan Nickel Corp. has commenced drilling at its 100%-owned Kenbridge Nickel-Copper-Cobalt Project in Northwestern Ontario. The drilling program aims to convert resources, test extensions of high-grade zones, and collect data for engineering and development studies.

title: NOVONIX’s patented, all-dry, zero-waste cathode synthesis technology
summary: NOVONIX has developed a patented, all-dry, zero-waste cathode synthesis technology that significantly reduces costs and environmental impact in nickel-based cathode production. This innovation supports sustainability throughout the nickel battery value chain, from mining to end-of-life recycling.

title: ACS honors sustainable chemistry innovators with 2025 Green Chemistry Challenge Awards
summary: Keary M. Engle was recognized for developing air-stable nickel catalysts that offer a cost-effective and energy-efficient alternative to traditional palladium catalysts. These catalysts enable streamlined production of medicines and advanced materials, highlighting nickel's role in sustainable chemistry innovations.

title: Reinventing America's critical minerals supply chain
summary: The US Department of Energy announced $1 billion in funding for initiatives including nickel to enhance domestic supply chains. The focus is on innovative refining techniques, recycling, and energy-efficient processes to support sustainable and secure nickel production critical for clean energy technologies.

title: Recycling legends trace past to guide e-scrap future
summary: Industry pioneers discussed the evolution of electronics recycling policies, highlighting early laws requiring manufacturers to recycle nickel cadmium batteries. This history informs current efforts to improve lithium-ion battery recycling and sustainability in nickel usage.

title: Looking Back at 2025: Navigating Challenges and Embracing Innovation
summary: The finishing industry has advanced sustainable metal reclamation methods, including nickel recovery from wastewater and electroless nickel plating. These innovations improve corrosion resistance and reduce environmental impact in aerospace and electronics applications.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali finalises a 200 million euro share capital increase and the acquisition of Special Melted Products in UK
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali completed a significant acquisition of Special Melted Products Ltd. (SMP) in the UK, strengthening its market position in stainless steel long products. The transaction, initially agreed in 2023, marks a major step in Cogne's growth strategy and is supported by a 200 million euro share capital increase.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali signs agreement to acquire 65% stake in Com.Steel Inox
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali signed a contract to acquire a 65% stake in Com.Steel Inox SpA, expanding its footprint in the stainless steel sector in Italy. This acquisition aligns with Cogne's strategy to consolidate its position in the European stainless steel market.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali to acquire Mannesmann Stainless Tubes
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali finalized a contract to acquire Mannesmann Stainless Tubes GmbH from Salzgitter AG for EUR 135 million. This acquisition enhances Cogne's position as a leading supplier of stainless steel and nickel alloy tubes in Europe and globally, supported by its parent company Walsin Lihwa.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: The ADVANT Alliance advises Cogne Acciai Speciali on the acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes
summary: The ADVANT Alliance provided legal advisory services to Cogne Acciai Speciali for its acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes GmbH. This cross-border transaction strengthens Cogne's European market presence and integrates MST into a vertically integrated steel company under Walsin Lihwa's ownership.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali published its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting its commitment to sustainability with over 94% of electricity sourced from renewables and a high rate of permanent employment contracts. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and long-term value creation.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali awarded ResponsibleSteel™ Certification
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali S.P.A. received the ResponsibleSteel™ Core Site Certification, recognizing its commitment to responsible and sustainable steel production practices. This certification aligns with the company's ongoing sustainability initiatives and industry leadership in Italy.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris buys Penn. shredder from SA Recycling
summary: US steelmaker Tenaris has acquired SA Recycling's shredder and processing yard in Beaver Falls, Pennsylvania. This acquisition allows Tenaris to gain greater control over its scrap supply stream and integrate steel production with scrap processing to streamline production.

title: Tenaris remains profitable in 2025
summary: Tenaris reported a $37 million profit in Q3 2025, a 15.6% increase from the previous quarter but down 22.9% from Q3 2024. Sales in the North American oil and gas tube market remained steady, with resilient drilling activity despite some recent reductions in the US, Canada, and Saudi Arabia. The company expects sales to remain stable but margins will be affected by increased tariff costs.

title: Tenaris S.A. Announces Share Buyback Program of Up to USD 1.2 Billion
summary: Tenaris announced a $1.2 billion share buyback program starting June 9, 2025, with the first tranche covering up to $600 million ending December 8, 2025. The shares acquired will be canceled over time, reflecting management's confidence amid oil and gas market conditions.

title: Tenaris reduced pipe sales to 2.95 million tons in January-September
summary: Tenaris sold 2.95 million tons of pipe products in the first nine months of 2025, a 2% decrease compared to the same period in 2024. This reflects a slight decline in demand or production during this timeframe.

title: Prysmian shares rise as Italian cable maker seen as winner amid US copper tariffs
summary: Prysmian shares rose nearly 4% on expectations that the company's large U.S. business will benefit from new U.S. copper tariffs. The firm's vertical integration in copper sourcing and production in the U.S. gives it a competitive edge, making it a relative winner amid tariff changes. Prysmian is the largest single buyer of copper worldwide and has a strong presence in the U.S. market following its acquisition of Texas-based Encore Wire.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian was awarded a contract by Terna S.p.A. and STEG to build a submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia under the Elmed Project, valued at around €460 million. This project aims to create an energy bridge between Europe and Africa to enhance energy security and support the transition to cleaner energy. The cable will run between Sicily and Tunisia, with installation by Prysmian's specialized vessel.

title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
summary: Prysmian views the U.S. 50% copper tariff as an opportunity to strengthen the American supply chain, benefiting from its domestic copper sourcing and vertical integration. The company, which acquired Texas-based Encore Wire, is in regular contact with the U.S. administration and expects the tariffs to reinforce the leadership of local players in the copper cable market. Prysmian produces about 220,000 metric tons of cable annually at its Dallas facility.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance following a strong third quarter, driven by growth in Renewable Transmission and Power Grids segments. The company reported €5.03 billion in Q3 revenue, beating consensus estimates, with strong performance in North America and Europe. Analysts note that benefits from copper tariffs may not yet be reflected but are expected to positively impact 2026 results.

title: Prysmian Raises Annual Targets After Record Q3 Performance
summary: Following a record third quarter, Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 financial targets. The Italian group highlighted strong performance across its business units, reflecting robust demand and operational execution. This update aligns with the company's positive outlook amid evolving market conditions including copper tariff impacts.
